column5: Hey guys, i was just wondering if anyone knew of some good spots to go ice fishingin and around Edmonton. i am headed out there to attend school in January and February, any help would be much appreciated, i assume that it is mostly pike and wallys and i was hoping to find a few lakes to jig, thanks a bunch Kerr

I have fished there a few times.  Not right in Edmonton but about 1-2 hours north.  You can fish waubman or pigeon lake which are closer to Edmonton and offer decent fishing.  Most lakes in and around the city are a bit shallow.  The North saskatchewan holds decent fish but it is very seasonal and access can be difficult.  I really can't help you but there is a good fishing shop called the fishin hole and I believe it is in the west end.  I am sure they can help you out.
If'n yer lookin' fer ice fishin' info for Edmonton and surrounding area ask Here and all shall be revealed!!!

Hey Kerr, Just got back from Edmonton, great city and some amazing fishing. Check out John Kokotilo http://www.northernspiritfishing.com . Loads of pike and walleye- I was amazing by the average size of the walleye while down there. Just wrote a blog about my trip  http://www.wfn.tv/blog/Jamie/ , In january you will have to drill.. getting cold there! have fun. Looking forward to your report  Jamie
THere are lots of good walleye in Alberta.  You are rarely allowed to keep any.  I guess that is why they have a great walleye fishery all over the provice.
right on thanks for the help guys, yeah its been cold up in the oil sands in fort mac so ill be well prepared
